property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: British soldiers during the Second Anglo-Afghan War

note.text: In the 1830s, 1870s, and in 1919, the British and Afghans fought a series of three wars. The British sought to end Russian influence in Afghanistan and to protect India.
The third Anglo-Afghan War in 1919 ended with an Afghan victory. Following that war, Afghanistan began a friendship with the newly established Soviet Union.
